t: Blessed*pn is the one whose*ld transgressions are forgiven, whose*ld sins are covered.
Blessed*ln is the one whose*ld sin the Lord*s does not count against them and*ld in whose spirit is no deceit.
When*pn I kept silent, my*ld bones wasted away through*ld my groaning all day long.
For*ln day and night your*ld hand was heavy on me; my*ln strength was sapped as*ld in the heat of summer.
Then*pn I acknowledged my sin to you and*ld did not cover up my iniquity. I*ln said, “I will confess my*ld transgressions to the Lord.”*s And*ln you forgave the*ld guilt of my sin.
Therefore*pn let all the faithful pray to you while*ld you may be found; surely*ln the rising of the mighty waters will*ld not reach them.
You*ln are my hiding place; you*ld will protect me from trouble and*ld surround me with songs of deliverance.
I*pn will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I*ld will counsel you with my loving eye on you.
Do*ln not be like the horse or the mule, which*ld have no understanding but*ln must be controlled by bit and bridle or*ld they will not come to you.
Many*ln are the woes of the wicked, but*ld the Lord’s*s unfailing love surrounds*ld the one who trusts in him.
Rejoice*pn in the Lord*s and be glad, you righteous; sing,*ld all you who are upright in heart!
